Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial of Anterior Pelvic Internal Fixation Versus External Fixation for Unstable Pelvic Ring Injuries

Trial_Design.evidence: randomised using a computer-generated sequence with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes

Participants.evidence: enrolled patients with unstable pelvic ring injuries at a single center

Intervention.evidence: compared anterior pelvic external fixation (APEF) with anterior pelvic internal fixation (APIF)

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the anterior pelvic bridge, a percutaneous method for anterior pelvic fixation.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was fracture reduction at 6 months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: randomised using a computer-generated sequence with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not applied to patients or clinicians, but outcome assessors were blinded.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of 23 eligible patients, 11 (four male, seven female) were randomised: six to APEF and five to APIF.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Functional outcomes favored APIF, with a mean difference in scores of 5.2 (95% CI 3.1 to 7.3; p = 0.01).

Harms.evidence: the APEF group had one pin tract infection
